com.compendium.ui
Class UILine

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              com.compendium.ui.UILine
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
UILink
public class UILine
extends javax.swing.JComponent

This is the base class for links in Compendium maps.

Author:
Ron van Hoof / Michelle Bachler
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
UILine()
          Creates a line with an absolute coordinate system (of the parent) and no arrows.
UILine(java.awt.Point ptFrom, java.awt.Point ptTo)
          Creates a line with the given to and from points in the coordinate system of its parent (absolute) and no arrows.
UILine(java.awt.Point ptFrom, java.awt.Point ptTo, int nArrow)
          Creates a line with the given to and from points in the coordinate system of its parent (absolute) with the given arrow.
UILine(java.awt.Point ptFrom, java.awt.Point ptTo, int nArrow, int nCoordinateType)
          Creates a line with the given to and from points in the coordinate system defined by the nType and adds arrows as defined by nArrow.

public UILine(java.awt.Point ptFrom,
              java.awt.Point ptTo,
              int nArrow,
              int nCoordinateType)
Creates a line with the given to and from points in the coordinate system defined by the nType and adds arrows as defined by nArrow.

Parameters:
ptFrom, - the origin point for the line.
ptTo, - the destination point for the line.
arrow, - the arrow style for this line.
nCoordinateType, - the coordinate type for this line (ABSOLUTE / RELATIVE).

UILine

public UILine(java.awt.Point ptFrom,
              java.awt.Point ptTo,
              int nArrow)
Creates a line with the given to and from points in the coordinate system of its parent (absolute) with the given arrow.

Parameters:
ptFrom, - the origin point for the line.
ptTo, - the destination point for the line.
arrow, - the arrow style for this line.

Method Detail

intersectionWithRectangle

public static java.awt.Point[] intersectionWithRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle r,
                                                         java.awt.Point a,
                                                         java.awt.Point b)
Returns the intersecting points of the line with the the given start and end point and given rectangle. If the line does not intersect with the rectangle an empty array will be returned

Parameters:
r - the Rectangle to check.
a - the origin point of the line to check.
b - the destination point of the line to check.
Returns:
Point[] the points the rectangle and line intersect.

computeIntersectionWithRectangle

private static java.awt.Point computeIntersectionWithRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle r,
                                                               java.awt.Point from,
                                                               java.awt.Point to)
Returns the intersecting point of the line with the given from and to point with the given rectangle. To get the other intersecting point the from and to points need to be reversed.

Parameters:
r - the Rectangle to check.
from - the origin point of the line to check.
to - the destination point of the line to check.
Returns:
Point the point the rectangle and line intersect, else null it they don't.

contains

private static boolean contains(java.awt.Rectangle r,
                                java.awt.Point p)
This contains method is a workaround for a bug in the contains method of Rectangle. It does not include the right and bottom sides as part of the rectangle.

Parameters:
r, - the Rectangle to check for the point in.
p, - the point for check for.
Returns:
boolean, true if the given rectangle contains the given point, else false.

intersectionWithLine

public java.awt.Point intersectionWithLine(UILine line)
Returns the intersecting point of this line with the given line. If the two lines are parallel null will be returned.

Parameters:
line - the line to check.
Returns:
Point the intersecting point of this line with the given line, else null if thye do not intercept.

intersectionWithRectangle

public java.awt.Point[] intersectionWithRectangle(java.awt.Rectangle r)
Returns the intersecting points of this line with the given rectangle. If the line does not intersect with the rectangle an empty array will be returned.

Parameters:
r, - the Rectangle to return the interception points for.
Returns:
Point[], the the intersecting points of this line with the given rectangle.

yIntercept

public double yIntercept()

onLine

public boolean onLine(java.awt.Point pt,
                      int d)
Checks whether the given point (pt) is on or close to the straight line formed by ptFrom and ptTo. The parameter 'd' defines the tolerance (max. allowable distance from the point to the line.

Parameters:
pt, - the point to check.
d, - the tolerance for the check.
Returns:
boolean true if the given point (pt) is on or close to the line formed by ptFrom and ptTo, else false.
